reviews.review_msg: All I can say is: Don't blame the french teachers at University. Blame the crappy British Columbia school system for not having a better high school french program. They need to fix that!

I've had her for three consecutive semesters now in 221, 222 and 300 and she is great! She is very kind and approachable and really enjoys making the class laugh. When it comes to marking there's not that much you can do as a French prof (either you got it wrong or you didn't). She is great!
Really knowledgeable and involved with students. Very funny and good-spirited, always smiling and easy to be around. Fantastic instructor.

this was my first french course that i took after high school and it made me not want to take another one! she was nice but a tough marker. not a lot of people in the class were doing well! she expects you to know more than has been taught!

awesome teacher.  always willing to help you out, if you'll help yourself out.  she's a tough marker, it's true: most people fail her first test/midterm.  but she's very animated in class and makes the class interesting with her stories, discussions, and debates!
The best prof ever. She was very nice and helpful. I wasn't planning to take any more French courses but after taking a class with her I decided to take more.  Can't wait to have her again.

Best French class I ever took (and I was expecting a nightmarishy tough course). Very clear both in her speaking and in content instruction/expectations. Enthusiastic and interesting teacher. Very personnable. You can tell she really does respect her students and enjoys working with them. High expectations, but willing to help you achieve them.

Good news: Really nice person (outside the classroom). Bad news: waaaay too many inconsistencies. Half the class fails the first exam (no joke), she gives a make up exam-- and most ppl do worst on that one then on the original. As so many ppl say when asked about her... there have been better.

She is nice, caring, help yet strict but by no means unfair. She is dedicated and very understanding. She is a good teacher despite her expectations. She marked compositions and gave great feedback. Good.

This is a difficult and demanding course, but if you put the time and effort into it, you will do well. Ghizlaine is a wonderful instructor, explains the material clearly and concisely, and is always there for extra help. I would take another class with her in a heartbeat.
Great teacher.  If you get a bad mark, you actually understand why.  But she will help you as much as possible to do well.
Excellent prof-- even if she is a bit demanding, her attitude and fair marking compensates.
She is exactly what a teacher should be. She is a fair marker and an excellent teacher.

She's super helpful and really cares about her students.  She treats you as a friend and as an equal, which is nice compared to some other profs.  She is definitely a hard marker, but you learn a lot from her.  And when you get a good mark, it means that much more!
Excellent prof. She made an otherwise boring class really interesting - she's really dynamic and fun. Super hard marker though. Expects a lot from students. Learned a lot in her class.
bored to listen to, and marking is a little bit hard
No Comments
she was nice at the start of semester, but marks REALLY hard and turned into a **** by the end
not helpful, didn`t learn anything.  She just wasn`t very good.
She's pretty easy and nice but kind of annoying to listen to.
